rulesStrings.li: questDescription->One of your colonists has discovered an ancient Archotech Component. It appears to be receiving a signal from an unknown origin. Rumours have linked these components to water somehow - maybe you should investigate?
questDescriptionBeforeAccepted->You've discovered the source of the signal's response. Investigate the site, and claim what you discover!\n\nEnter the site and claim the building as your own.

questDescriptionAfterAccepted->The site holds what appears to be an archotech machine. As far as you can tell, it's linked to something beneath the surface, something big.\nOn closer inspection, you find slots that look like the archotech component you found would fit perfectly. There's 3 of them. Maybe try connecting them all up?

questDescriptionBeforeAccepted->After inserting the last component, the Power Regulator whirred into action. To what end - you have no idea.

An interface on the building came online showing what appeared to be logs and notes. In them, there's scattered references to a great drought, interspersed with references to a grand Archotech machine. It appears the two may be related, but you do not yet know how.

The data described a Catalytic Separator, required for the grand machination.
 Shortly after reading this, the machine began emitting a new signal. To your surprise, it got a response!

Claim what you find and investigate.

questDescriptionAfterAccepted->This time, you've found what appears to be some form of catalytic separator. You're not sure what it's purpose is, but as before, you see 3 familiar slots.\n\nAdd 3 Archotech Components to the Catalytic Separator.

questDescriptionBeforeAccepted->As before, the Catalytic Separator comes to life, and as before, you have no idea what it's doing. You find another interface terminal, and begin gathering data.
Based on this new data, you're pretty sure that the archotech machine was an attempt to fix the drought, that was never completed. Some sporadic logs talk of a great war that tore nations apart, and ravaged the climate of this planet. In its wake, some survivors took it upon themselves to try to fix things. While they got much work done, squabbles over resources, especially what water was available eventually tore the group apart.
A signal goes out, and receives a response.

Claim what you find and investigate.
questDescriptionAfterAccepted->You yet again trace the signal, this time to a Sterilization plant. Yet again, there's 3 slots. Connect them up!
descriptionThreats(threatsEnabled==true)->The archospring will likely have defenders, so go prepared.\n\n
